<title>Tunnel of Love | Bruce Springsteen</title>
<meta name="description" content="The Boss' eighth studio album uncovers "an inner life and unresolved feelings," as Bruce turns his gaze inward for an entire record following the explosion of Born in the U.S.A." />
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1" />
<link rel="canonical" href="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/tunnel-of-love/" />
<meta property="og:locale" content="en_US" />
<meta property="og:type" content="article" />
<meta property="og:title" content="Tunnel of Love" />
<meta property="og:description" content="The Boss' eighth studio album uncovers "an inner life and unresolved feelings," as Bruce turns his gaze inward for an entire record following the explosion of Born in the U.S.A. The end of a marriage and the beginning of a ten-year break with his long-standing band (who appear only spottily here) make for a powerful and reflective listening experience." />
<meta property="og:url" content="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/tunnel-of-love/" />

The end of a marriage and the beginning of a ten-year break with his long-standing band (who appear only spottily here) make for a powerful and reflective listening experience." />

yoast_head_json.title: Tunnel of Love | Bruce Springsteen
yoast_head_json.description: The Boss' eighth studio album uncovers "an inner life and unresolved feelings," as Bruce turns his gaze inward for an entire record following the explosion of Born in the U.S.A.
yoast_head_json.og_description: The Boss' eighth studio album uncovers "an inner life and unresolved feelings," as Bruce turns his gaze inward for an entire record following the explosion of Born in the U.S.A. The end of a marriage and the beginning of a ten-year break with his long-standing band (who appear only spottily here) make for a powerful and reflective listening experience.
yoast_head_json.twitter_description: The Boss' eighth studio album uncovers "an inner life and unresolved feelings," as Bruce turns his gaze inward for an entire record following the explosion of Born in the U.S.A. The end of a marriage and the beginning of a ten-year break with his long-standing band (who appear only spottily here) make for a powerful and reflective listening experience.
